questions.question: Boundaries are:
questions.explanation: Boundaries are limits that protect your well-being and can be set with love and compassion.

questions.question: Healthy relationships include:
questions.explanation: Healthy relationships involve mutual respect, clear communication, and the ability to handle conflict constructively.

questions.question: Setting boundaries with narcissistic patterns:
questions.explanation: You can set boundaries with compassion while protecting yourself from harmful patterns.

questions.question: Healthy conflict:
options: Can strengthen relationships when handled well
questions.explanation: When handled constructively, conflict can actually strengthen relationships by improving understanding.

questions.question: Codependency involves:
questions.explanation: Codependency involves losing yourself in relationships and taking responsibility for others' emotions.

questions.question: Red flags are:
options: Early warning signs to pay attention to
questions.explanation: Red flags are early warning signs that help you make informed choices about relationships.

questions.question: Give one characteristic of a healthy relationship:
questions.explanation: Healthy relationships include mutual respect, clear communication, boundaries, support, conflict resolution, and trust.

questions.question: Why are boundaries important in relationships?
questions.explanation: Boundaries protect your well-being, create safety and respect, and allow for healthier connections in relationships.
